ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned and improved on how to write and present Chinese sophisticated at an elevated level. I also learned about Chinas society issue and it history.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think that the textbook is simply too hard. It was kind of ridiculous to memorize 200 multi-character phrases every week and complete an essay or presentation on top of that. Also, there is little to no opportunity to develop speaking skills.

interesting content, useful words, instructor provided wider exposure to Chinese history/culture than what was offered in the textbook. would have been nice to have more opportunities for interaction with fellow students and more chances to speak (like having debates)

The strengths of this class was that the class size was small l, allowing for greater engagement. Additionally, the deadlines for assignments were often lenient and the teacher was really passionate about teaching.
Love suwei. Hes an amazing teacher. No weaknesses except for difficulty.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you are interested in improving your reading and writing skills and learn about some political history in China. No, if you are looking to improve general spoken fluency. Lessons were extremely niche and focused on topics that were often outdated and passe.
yes, it's a great way of pushing your Chinese

Yes, if you are looking to challenge yourself and improve your level of Chinese in my writing, reading, and understanding, I would definitely recommend you take this class. This class also dives into more serious societal issues that are important to todays society that often talked about and relevant to the professional world.
Yep. Take a class with suwei. Hes amazing.
